question: What is the first thing you usually do after you wake up?
Do you enjoy cooking or do you prefer eating out?
How often do you use your mobile phone for learning?
What kinds of books do you like reading most?
Do you spend much time outdoors in your free time?

cueCard:
Describe a book you have read more than once.
You should say:
• what the book is called
• what it is about
• why you read it more than once
and explain how you felt after reading it again.
followups: Do people in your country like reading physical books or e-books more?
How important are libraries for communities today?

cueCard:
Describe a city you would like to live in for a short time.
You should say:
• which city it is
• why you chose it
• what you would do there
and explain how living there would help you.
followups: Why do some people prefer living in cities to the countryside?
How will smart technology change cities in the future?

cueCard:
Describe an invention that has changed people’s lives.
You should say:
• what the invention is
• who invented it
• how it has changed people’s lives
and explain whether it has had any negative effects.
followups: Do you think we rely too much on modern inventions?
Which invention do you think will be developed next?

cueCard:
Describe a person who has helped you learn something important.
You should say:
• who the person is
• what you learned from them
• how they helped you learn it
and explain how this knowledge has influenced you.
followups: Do people still need teachers when so much learning is online?
What qualities make a good mentor?

cueCard:
Describe a healthy habit you have developed.
You should say:
• what the habit is
• when you started it
• how often you practise it
and explain how it has improved your life.
followups: How has people’s understanding of health changed recently?
Should governments encourage healthy lifestyles more actively?
